extendedIngredients.name: bok choy
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunch bok choy, ends trimmed and separated into leaves

extendedIngredients.name: eggplant
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 eggplant, ends trimmed and sliced to 1/2-inch thick half-rounds

extendedIngredients.name: pork
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 pounds pork spareribs, cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: radish
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 6-inch white radish, peeled and sliced to 1/2-inch thick half-rounds

extendedIngredients.name: tamarind
extendedIngredients.originalString: 15 tamarind pieces or 1-1/2 package of tamarind base powder

extendedIngredients.name: yard long beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 bunch long beans (sitaw), ends trimmed and cut into 3-inch lengths

recipes.title: Sinigang na Baboy (Pork Ribs Sour Soup)
recipes.instructions: Wash pork ribs. In a pot over medium heat, combine pork and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, skimming off scum that accumulates on top. Once broth clears, add tomatoes, onions and fish sauce. Lower heat and simmer for about 1 to 1-1/2 hours or until meat is tender, adding more water as necessary to maintain about 10 cups. Add chili and radish. Continue to simmer for about 2 to 3 minutes. Add long beans. Continue to cook for about 2 minutes. Add eggplant and okra and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes.If using packaged tamarind base, add into pot and stir until completely dissolved. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add bok choy and continue to cook for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and serve hot.Wash tamarind and place in a pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook until soft and outer skins begin to burst. With a fork, mash tamarinds. In a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl, pour tamarind and liquid. Continue to mash with a fork, returning some of the liquid into the strainer once or twice, to fully extract juice. Discard seeds and skins. Pour tamarind juice into sinigang.

steps.step: Wash pork ribs. In a pot over medium heat, combine pork and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, skimming off scum that accumulates on top. Once broth clears, add tomatoes, onions and fish sauce. Lower heat and simmer for about 1 to 1-1/2 hours or until meat is tender, adding more water as necessary to maintain about 10 cups.
Add chili and radish. Continue to simmer for about 2 to 3 minutes.
Add long beans. Continue to cook for about 2 minutes.
Add eggplant and okra and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes.If using packaged tamarind base, add into pot and stir until completely dissolved. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add bok choy and continue to cook for about 1 minute.

Remove from heat and serve hot.Wash tamarind and place in a pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook until soft and outer skins begin to burst. With a fork, mash tamarinds. In a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl, pour tamarind and liquid. Continue to mash with a fork, returning some of the liquid into the strainer once or twice, to fully extract juice. Discard seeds and skins.
